poses.name: Child's Pose
poses.description: A gentle resting pose that helps ground Vata energy and calm the nervous system. Perfect for reducing anxiety and stress.
instructions: Lower your torso between your thighs
Extend arms forward or alongside body
Breathe deeply and hold for 5-10 minutes

doshaSpecific.vata: Excellent for grounding and calming Vata energy. Practice slowly and hold longer.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Can be cooling but avoid if it causes frustration. Use props for comfort.
doshaSpecific.kapha: Good for opening chest and shoulders. May need to hold shorter duration.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

poses.name: Legs Up the Wall
poses.description: A gentle inversion that helps calm Vata energy and reduce anxiety. Perfect for evening practice.
instructions: Lie back and rest arms by sides
Bend knees and roll to side to exit

doshaSpecific.vata: Excellent for calming and grounding. Practice daily for best results.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Cooling and soothing. Good for reducing heat and irritation.
doshaSpecific.kapha: May feel too passive. Combine with gentle movement.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

poses.name: Seated Forward Bend
poses.description: A cooling forward bend that helps balance Pitta energy and reduce heat in the body and mind.
instructions: Exhale and fold forward from hips
Reach for feet, ankles, or shins
Keep spine long, don't round back
Hold for 5-10 minutes with deep breathing

doshaSpecific.vata: Be gentle and use props. Don't force the stretch.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Excellent for cooling and calming. Practice in cool environment.
doshaSpecific.kapha: Good for opening back body. May need to hold longer.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

poses.name: Fish Pose
poses.description: A gentle backbend that opens the heart and helps cool Pitta energy while improving breathing.
instructions: Lie on back with legs extended
Place hands under hips, palms down
Rest crown of head on floor
Breathe deeply and hold for 3-5 minutes

doshaSpecific.vata: Be gentle and use props. Don't overextend.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Excellent for cooling and opening heart. Practice regularly.
doshaSpecific.kapha: Good for opening chest. May need support under back.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

poses.name: Sun Salutation
poses.description: A dynamic sequence that helps energize Kapha and stimulate metabolism. Perfect for morning practice.

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice slowly and mindfully. Don't rush.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Practice in cool environment. Avoid overexertion.
doshaSpecific.kapha: Excellent for energizing. Practice vigorously and regularly.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

poses.name: Warrior I
poses.description: A powerful standing pose that builds strength and energy, perfect for stimulating Kapha.

doshaSpecific.vata: Be gentle and don't overextend. Use props if needed.
doshaSpecific.pitta: Practice in cool environment. Focus on breath.
doshaSpecific.kapha: Excellent for building energy. Hold longer and practice regularly.

sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

sequences.name: Vata Balancing Sequence
sequences.description: A gentle sequence designed to ground and calm Vata energy
instructions: Begin with 5 minutes of gentle breathing
sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

sequences.name: Pitta Cooling Sequence
sequences.description: A cooling sequence to balance Pitta energy and reduce heat
instructions: Practice in a cool, quiet environment
Focus on cooling and soothing movements
Hold poses longer for deeper effect
sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

sequences.name: Kapha Energizing Sequence
sequences.description: A dynamic sequence to energize Kapha and stimulate metabolism
instructions: Practice in the morning when energy is low
sources: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley

metadata.source: Yoga for Your Type - David Frawley & Sandra Summerfield Kozak
